ACCESSIBILITY.Defintion: ease of use, ease to get

CATALOGUE.Defintion: a magazine with a list of things you can buy

COUNTER ARGUMENT.Defintion: a point that is opposite to what was previously said

DEVASTATING.Defintion: very bad, causing a lot of damage

DRUG REHABILITATION.Defintion: helping drug addicts stop using drugs

GATEWAY DRUGS.Defintion: drugs that make it more likely that a harder (and more dangerous) drug will be used

HIPPIE.Defintion: someone in the 1960s and 1970s who was against violence

HIPPY.Defintion: someone in the 1960s and 1970s who was against violence

IMPLICIT.Defintion: suggested or understood, but not said

INORDINATE.Defintion: much more than expected or would be fair

INSOMNIA.Defintion: the condition of not being able to sleep

LIBERTARIAN.Defintion: someone who thinks that people should be free to do what they please without government interference

MENACE.Defintion: threat, something that is likely to cause harm

MORPHINE.Defintion: a drug made from opium, often used for pain relief

OPIATES.Defintion: drugs that contain opium, often used for pain relief

OPIUM.Defintion: a drug made from poppy seeds

POLICYMAKERS.Defintion: people who decide policy and laws

PROPHECIES.Defintion: statements about what will happen in the future

RAID.Defintion: make a surprise visit (especially by police or soldiers)

SYNTHESISED.Defintion: produce a substance via a chemical reaction

SYRINGE.Defintion: a medical piece of equipment used for sucking liquid out or inserting liquid into somewhere

SYRINGES.Defintion: a medical piece of equipment used for sucking liquid out or inserting liquid into somewhere

VEINS.Defintion: the tubes that carry blood to the heart

VETERANS.Defintion: soldiers who fought in a war

VILIFY.Defintion: to talk about in a negative way in order to get others to develop a negative opinion (of that person or group)
